customer.models¶

What follows are the details of the customer.models implementation.

class customer.models.Deposit(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A deposit is for persisting when a user deposits crypto into the system in exchange for fiat

Parameters:
  • id (AutoField) – Id
  • invoice_id (UUIDField) – Invoice id
  • amount (FloatField) – Amount
  • user (ForeignKey to PSPUser) – User
  • sender_account_id (CharField) – Sender account id
  • receiver_account_id (CharField) – Receiver account id
  • neo_sender_address (CharField) – Neo sender address
  • asset (CharField) – Asset
  • gas_price (FloatField) – Gas price
  • fee (FloatField) – Fee
  • total_gas (FloatField) – Total gas
  • total_fee (FloatField) – Total fee
  • total (FloatField) – Total
  • status (CharField) – Status
  • transfer_url (CharField) – Transfer url
  • date_created (DateTimeField) – Date created
  • date_updated (DateTimeField) – Date updated
  • failure_reason (CharField) – Failure reason
  • blockchain_transfer (OneToOneField to BlockchainTransfer) – Blockchain transfer
  • deposit_wallet (OneToOneField to DepositWallet) – Deposit wallet

class customer.models.PSPUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

PSP User is the model that represents any user on the website, whether admins or consumers. It inherits/conforms to the normal django user conventions

Parameters:
  • id (AutoField) – Id
  • password (CharField) – Password
  • is_superuser (BooleanField) – Designates that this user has all permissions without explicitly assigning them.
  • email (EmailField) – Email address
  • first_name (CharField) – First name
  • last_name (CharField) – Last name
  • is_active (BooleanField) – Is active
  • is_admin (BooleanField) – Is admin
  • date_joined (DateTimeField) – Date joined
  • last_login (DateTimeField) – Last login
  • dwolla_url (URLField) – Dwolla url
  • customer_type (CharField) – Customer type
  • address1 (CharField) – Address1
  • address2 (CharField) – Address2
  • city (CharField) – City
  • postal_code (USZipCodeField) – Postal code
  • state (USStateField) – State
  • ssn_lastfour (CharField) – Ssn lastfour
  • date_of_birth (DateField) – Date of birth
  • is_seller (BooleanField) – Is seller
  • pending_deposit (ForeignKey to Deposit) – Pending deposit
  • groups (ManyToManyField) – The groups this user belongs to. A user will get all permissions granted to each of their groups.
  • user_permissions (ManyToManyField) – Specific permissions for this user.
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
REQUIRED_FIELDS = ['first_name', 'last_name', 'address1', 'city', 'postal_code', 'state', 'ssn_lastfour', 'date_of_birth']¶
USERNAME_FIELD = 'email'¶

class customer.models.PSPUserManager[source]¶

PSPUSer manager is a custom user manager for customer.models.PSPUser

create_superuser(email, first_name, last_name, address1, city, postal_code, state, ssn_lastfour, date_of_birth, password)[source]¶

Creates and saves a superuser with the given email, date of birth and password.

create_user(email, first, last, address1, city, postal_code, state, ssn_lastfour, date_of_birth, password=None)[source]¶

Creates and saves a User with the given email, date of birth and password.

class customer.models.Purchase(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A Purchase represents when a user sends fiat to the ReceivableAccount

Parameters:
  • id (AutoField) – Id
  • asset (CharField) – Asset
  • amount (FloatField) – Amount
  • user (ForeignKey to PSPUser) – User
  • sender_account_id (CharField) – Sender account id
  • receiver_account_id (CharField) – Receiver account id
  • neo_address (CharField) – Neo address
  • gas_price (FloatField) – Gas price
  • fee (FloatField) – Fee
  • total_gas (FloatField) – Total gas
  • total_fee (FloatField) – Total fee
  • total (FloatField) – Total
  • status (CharField) – Status
  • transfer_url (CharField) – Transfer url
  • date_created (DateTimeField) – Date created
  • date_updated (DateTimeField) – Date updated
  • failure_reason (CharField) – Failure reason
  • blockchain_transfer (OneToOneField to BlockchainTransfer) – Blockchain transfer

class customer.models.ReceiveableAccount(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This is a model used to represent the main PSP user and associate them with their main bank account in dwolla

Parameters:
  • id (AutoField) – Id
  • user (ForeignKey to PSPUser) – User
  • account_id (CharField) – Account id
static Default()[source]¶

There should only be one, so this is kind of a singleton for retrieving it :returns: customer.models.ReceivableAccount

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Model field: account id

customer_url¶

The url for the receivable account customer dwolla account :returns: str

funding_url¶

The url for the receivable account customer funding dwolla account

Returns:str

customer.models.on_pspuser_saved(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]¶

When a PSP user is saved, we check to see if they are associatde with the dwolla system ( dwolla_url ) if not, we will create a dwolla user

Parameters:
  • sender (customer.models.PSPUser) – the model class that sends this event
  • instance (customer.models.PSPUser) – the instance of the model associated with this event
  • created (bool) – whether this instance has just been created
  • **kwargs –
